info.title: Subscriptions
info.description: You can use billing plans and subscriptions to create subscriptions that process recurring PayPal payments for physical or digital goods, or services. A plan includes pricing and billing cycle information that defines the amount and frequency of charge for a subscription. You can also define a fixed plan, such as a $5 basic plan or a volume- or graduated-based plan with pricing tiers based on the quantity purchased. For more information, see Subscriptions Overview.

post.description: Creates a plan that defines pricing and billing cycle details for subscriptions.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that shows billing plan details.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `201 Created` status code and a JSON response body that shows billing plan details.

parameters.description: To make REST API calls, include the bearer token in the Authorization header with the Bearer authentication scheme. The value is Bearer <Access-Token> or Basic <client_id>:<secret>.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type. Required for operations with a request body. The value is `application/<format>`, where the `format` is `json`.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description:
The preferred server response upon successful completion of the request. Value is:
  • return=minimal. The server returns a minimal response to optimize communication between the API caller and the server. A minimal response includes the id, status and HATEOAS links.
  • return=representation. The server returns a complete resource representation, including the current state of the resource.

patch.description:
Updates a plan with the `CREATED` or `ACTIVE` status. For an `INACTIVE` plan, you can make only status updates.
You can patch these attributes and objects:
Attribute or objectOperations
descriptionreplace
payment_preferences.auto_bill_outstandingreplace
taxes.percentagereplace
payment_preferences.payment_failure_thresholdreplace
payment_preferences.setup_feereplace
payment_preferences.setup_fee_failure_actionreplace

patch.description:
Updates a subscription which could be in `ACTIVE` or `SUSPENDED` status.
Following are the fields eligible for patch.
Attribute or objectOperationsVisibility
billing_info.outstanding_balancereplaceExternal
custom_id (supported only for V1 subscriptions)add,replaceExternal
plan.billing_cycles[@sequence==n].pricing_scheme.fixed_priceadd,replaceExternal
plan.billing_cycles[@sequence==n].shipping_amount (not supported for V1 subscriptions)add,replaceInternal
plan.billing_cycles[@sequence==n].taxes.amount (not supported for V1 subscriptions)add,replaceInternal
plan.billing_cycles[@sequence==n].total_cyclesreplaceExternal
plan.name (not supported for V1 subscriptions)replaceInternal
plan.payment_preferences.auto_bill_outstandingreplaceExternal
plan.payment_preferences.payment_failure_thresholdreplaceExternal
plan.taxes.inclusive (supported only for V1 subscriptions)add,replaceExternal
plan.taxes.percentage (supported only for V1 subscriptions)add,replaceExternal
shipping_amount (supported only for V1 subscriptions)add,replaceExternal
start_time (for subscription whose start time is in future)replaceExternal
subscriber.shipping_addressadd,replaceExternal
subscriber.payment_source (for subscriptions funded by card payments)replaceExternal
subscriber.name.given_name (for unbranded subscriptions)add,replaceInternal
subscriber.name.surname (for unbranded subscriptions)add,replaceInternal
subscriber.email_address (for unbranded subscriptions)add,replaceInternal
subscriber.phone.phone_number (for unbranded subscriptions)add,replaceInternal
status_change_noteadd,replaceInternal

tags.name: plans
tags.description: Use the `/billing/plans` resource to create and manage plans.

tags.name: subscriptions
tags.description: Use the `/billing/subscriptions` resource to create and manage subscriptions.

id.description: The unique PayPal-generated ID for the plan.

x-enum.description: The plan was created. You cannot create subscriptions for a plan in this state.
The plan is inactive.
The plan is active. You can only create subscriptions for a plan in this state.

description.description: The detailed description of the plan.

usage_type.description: The type of the plan, which indicates the billing pattern.

x-enum.description: A licensed plan.
A metered plan.

billing_cycles.description: An array of billing cycles for trial billing and regular billing. A plan can have at most two trial cycles and only one regular cycle.

quantity_supported.description: Indicates whether you can subscribe to this plan by providing a quantity for the goods or service.

create_time.description: The date and time when the plan was created, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

update_time.description: The date and time when the plan was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

pricing_scheme.description: The active pricing scheme for this billing cycle. A free trial billing cycle does not require a pricing scheme.

frequency.description: The frequency details for this billing cycle.

tenure_type.description: The tenure type of the billing cycle. In case of a plan having trial cycle, only 2 trial cycles are allowed per plan.

x-enum.description: A regular billing cycle.
A trial billing cycle.

sequence.description: The order in which this cycle is to run among other billing cycles. For example, a trial billing cycle has a `sequence` of `1` while a regular billing cycle has a `sequence` of `2`, so that trial cycle runs before the regular cycle.

total_cycles.description: The number of times this billing cycle gets executed. Trial billing cycles can only be executed a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles). Regular billing cycles can be executed infinite times (value of 0 for total_cycles) or a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles).

taxes.description: The taxation charges for legacy recurring payments.

shipping_amount.description: The shipping charges for legacy recurring payments.

version.description: The version of the pricing scheme.

status.description: The status of the pricing scheme.

x-enum.description: The pricing scheme change is in progress.
The pricing scheme change is active.
The pricing scheme is inactive.

fixed_price.description: The fixed amount to charge for the subscription. The changes to fixed amount are applicable to both existing and future subscriptions. For existing subscriptions, payments within 10 days of price change are not affected.

tier_mode.description: The pricing model for tiered plan. The `tiers` parameter is required.

x-enum.description: A volume-tiered model.
A graduated-tiered model.

tiers.description: An array of pricing tiers which are used for billing volume/graduated plans. tier_mode field has to be specified.

roll_out_strategy.description: Not exposed to merchants for the initial release. If not specified, the pricing changes will apply to all existing (with current time as effective time and applies to next scheduled payment) and new subscriptions.

create_time.description: The date and time when this pricing scheme was created, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

update_time.description: The date and time when this pricing scheme was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Money
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

starting_quantity.description: The starting quantity for the tier.

ending_quantity.description: The ending quantity for the tier. Optional for the last tier.

amount.description: The pricing amount for the tier.

roll_out_strategy.json.title: Roll-out Strategy for Pricing Scheme Change
roll_out_strategy.json.description: The roll-out strategy for a pricing scheme update. After the pricing update, all new subscriptions are based on this pricing scheme and the values in this object determine the behavior for the existing subscriptions.

effective_time.description: The date and time when the pricing scheme change becomes effective, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

process_change_from.description: The date and time when this pricing change goes into effect, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Applies only if the plan's pricing scheme is updated.

x-enum.description: The pricing change takes effect from the next billing payment after the effective time.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.

frequency.json.title: Billing Cycle Frequency

interval_unit.description: The interval at which the subscription is charged or billed.

x-enum.description: A daily billing cycle.
A weekly billing cycle.
A monthly billing cycle.
A monthly billing cycle.
A yearly billing cycle.

interval_count.description:
The number of intervals after which a subscriber is billed. For example, if the `interval_unit` is `DAY` with an `interval_count` of `2`, the subscription is billed once every two days. The following table lists the maximum allowed values for the `interval_count` for each `interval_unit`:
Interval unitMaximum interval count
DAY365
WEEK52
MONTH12
YEAR1

percentage.description: The tax percentage on the billing amount.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the tax was already included in the billing amount.

amount.description: The tax amount. Used to support legacy migration. Either percentage or amount can be used but not both.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The percentage, as a fixed-point, signed decimal number. For example, define a 19.99% interest rate as `19.99`.

payment_preferences.json.title: Payment Preferences
payment_preferences.json.description: The payment preferences for a subscription.

x-enum.description: A prepaid billing cycle.
A postpaid billing cycle.

auto_bill_outstanding.description: Indicates whether to automatically bill the outstanding amount in the next billing cycle.

setup_fee.description: The initial set-up fee for the service.

setup_fee_failure_action.description: The action to take on the subscription if the initial payment for the setup fails.

x-enum.description: Continues the subscription if the initial payment for the setup fails.
Cancels the subscription if the initial payment for the setup fails.

payment_failure_threshold.description: The maximum number of payment failures before a subscription is suspended. For example, if `payment_failure_threshold` is `2`, the subscription automatically updates to the `SUSPEND` state if two consecutive payments fail.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Payee
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The merchant who receives the funds and fulfills the order. The merchant is also known as the payee.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Merchant Base
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The details for the merchant who receives the funds and fulfills the order. The merchant is also known as the payee.

merchant_id.description: The encrypted PayPal account ID of the merchant.

client_id.description: The public ID for the payee- or merchant-created app. Introduced to support use cases, such as BrainTree integration with PayPal, where payee `email_address` or `merchant_id` is not available.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: PayPal Account Identifier
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The account identifier for a PayPal account.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Displayable Merchant Information
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The merchant information. The merchant is also known as the payee. Appears to the customer in checkout, transactions, email receipts, and transaction history.

business_email.description: The email address of the merchant. Appears to the customer in checkout, transactions, email receipts, and transaction history.

business_phone.description: The phone number of the merchant. Appears to the customer in checkout, payment transactions, email receipts, and transaction history.

brand_name.description: The name of the merchant. Appears to the customer in checkout, payment transactions, email receipts, and transaction history.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Phone
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Link Description
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The request-related [HATEOAS link](/docs/api/reference/api-responses/#hateoas-links) information.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

mediaType.description: The media type, as defined by [RFC 2046](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2046.txt). Describes the link target.

encType.description: The media type in which to submit the request data.

schema.description: The schema that describes the request data.

targetSchema.description: The schema that describes the link target.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The request data or link target.

anyOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against one or more sub-schemas.

items.title: Any Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

oneOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against one sub-schema.

items.title: One Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

media.description: The media type and context-encoding scheme.

type.description: The media type. See [Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part Two: Media Types](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2046).

binaryEncoding.description: The content-encoding scheme. See [Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part One: Format of Internet Message Bodies](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045).

pathStart.description: To apply this schema to the instances' URIs, start the URIs with this value.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Error
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The error details.

name.description: The human-readable, unique name of the error.

message.description: The message that describes the error.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Error Details
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

status.description: The initial state of the plan. Allowed input values are CREATED and ACTIVE.

x-enum.description: The plan was created. You cannot create subscriptions for a plan in this state.
The plan is inactive.
The plan is active. You can only create subscriptions for a plan in this state.

description.description: The detailed description of the plan.

usage_type.description: The plan type, which indicates the billing pattern.

x-enum.description: A licensed plan. Has a fixed billing amount.
A metered plan. Billed based on service consumption.

billing_cycles.description: An array of billing cycles for trial billing and regular billing. A plan can have at most two trial cycles and only one regular cycle.

quantity_supported.description: Indicates whether you can subscribe to this plan by providing a quantity for the goods or service.

plan_collection.json.title: Plan Collection
plan_collection.json.description: The list of plans with details.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Patch Request
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: An array of JSON patch objects to apply partial updates to resources.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Patch
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The JSON patch object to apply partial updates to resources.

x-enum.description:
Depending on the target location reference, completes one of these functions:
  • The target location is an array index. Inserts a new value into the array at the specified index.
  • The target location is an object parameter that does not already exist. Adds a new parameter to the object.
  • The target location is an object parameter that does exist. Replaces that parameter's value.
The value parameter defines the value to add. For more information, see 4.1. add.
Removes the value at the target location. For the operation to succeed, the target location must exist. For more information, see 4.2. remove.

Replaces the value at the target location with a new value. The operation object must contain a value parameter that defines the replacement value. For the operation to succeed, the target location must exist. For more information, see 4.3. replace.

Removes the value at a specified location and adds it to the target location. The operation object must contain a from parameter, which is a string that contains a JSON pointer value that references the location in the target document from which to move the value. For the operation to succeed, the from location must exist. For more information, see 4.4. move.

Copies the value at a specified location to the target location. The operation object must contain a from parameter, which is a string that contains a JSON pointer value that references the location in the target document from which to copy the value. For the operation to succeed, the from location must exist. For more information, see 4.5. copy.

Tests that a value at the target location is equal to a specified value. The operation object must contain a value parameter that defines the value to compare to the target location's value. For the operation to succeed, the target location must be equal to the value value. For test, equal indicates that the value at the target location and the value that value defines are of the same JSON type. The data type of the value determines how equality is defined:
TypeConsidered equal if both values
stringsContain the same number of Unicode characters and their code points are byte-by-byte equal.
numbersAre numerically equal.
arraysContain the same number of values, and each value is equal to the value at the corresponding position in the other array, by using these type-specific rules.
objectsContain the same number of parameters, and each parameter is equal to a parameter in the other object, by comparing their keys (as strings) and their values (by using these type-specific rules).
literals (false, true, and null)Are the same. The comparison is a logical comparison. For example, whitespace between the parameter values of an array is not significant. Also, ordering of the serialization of object parameters is not significant.
For more information, see 4.6. test.

path.description: The JSON Pointer to the target document location at which to complete the operation.

value.title: Patch Value
value.description: The value to apply. The remove operation does not require a value.

from.description: The JSON Pointer to the target document location from which to move the value. Required for the move operation.

update_pricing_scheme_request.json.description: The update pricing scheme request details.

auto_renewal.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates whether the subscription auto-renews after the billing cycles complete.

preferred_currency_conversion.description: The payer's preferred currency conversion option. Value is `PAYPAL` or `VENDOR`.

metadata.description: JSON Web Token (JWT) that can be associated with the subscription. This does not influence the subscription behavior and is just a pass through data.

custom_id.description: The custom id for the subscription. Can be invoice id.

plan_overridden.description: Indicates whether the subscription has overridden any plan attributes.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Customer
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The customer who approves and pays for the order. The customer is also known as the payer.

name.description: The name of the payer. Supports only the `given_name` and `surname` properties.

email_address.description: The email address of the payer.

payer_id.description: The PayPal-assigned ID for the payer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer. Available only when you enable the **Contact Telephone Number** option in the **Profile & Settings** for the merchant's PayPal account. The `phone.phone_number` supports only `national_number`.

birth_date.description: The birth date of the payer in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

tax_info.description: The tax information of the payer. Required only for Brazilian payer's. Both `tax_id` and `tax_id_type` are required.

address.description: The address of the payer. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties. Also referred to as the billing address of the customer.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Name
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The name of the party.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

middle_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

alternate_full_name.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Phone With Type
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The phone information.

phone_number.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). Supports only the `national_number` property.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Phone Type
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The phone type.

The stand-alone date, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). To represent special legal values, such as a date of birth, you should use dates with no associated time or time-zone data. Whenever possible, use the standard `date_time` type. This regular expression does not validate all dates. For example, February 31 is valid and nothing is known about leap years.
The tax ID of the customer. The customer is also known as the payer. Both `tax_id` and `tax_id_type` are required.
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Tax Information

tax_id.description: The customer's tax ID. Supported for the PayPal payment method only. Typically, the tax ID is 11 characters long for individuals and 14 characters long for businesses.

tax_id_type.description: The customer's tax ID type. Supported for the PayPal payment method only.

x-enum.description: The individual tax ID type.
The business tax ID type.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if needed. For example, a street complement for Brazil, direction text, such as `next to Walmart`, or a landmark in an Indian address.

admin_area_4.description:
The neighborhood, ward, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_3` or `sub_locality`. Value is:
  • The postal sorting code for Guernsey and many French territories, such as French Guiana.
  • The fine-grained administrative levels in China.

admin_area_3.description:
A sub-locality, suburb, neighborhood, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_2`. Value is:
  • Brazil. Suburb, bairro, or neighborhood.
  • India. Sub-locality or district. Street name information is not always available but a sub-locality or district can be a very small area.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

address_details.title: Address Details
address_details.description:
The non-portable additional address details that are sometimes needed for compliance, risk, or other scenarios where fine-grain address information might be needed. Not portable with common third party and open source. Redundant with core fields.
For example, `address_portable.address_line_1` is usually a combination of `address_details.street_number`, `street_name`, and `street_type`.

street_name.description: The street name. Just `Drury` in `Drury Lane`.

street_type.description: The street type. For example, avenue, boulevard, road, or expressway.

delivery_service.description: The delivery service. Post office box, bag number, or post office name.

building_name.description: A named locations that represents the premise. Usually a building name or number or collection of buildings with a common name or number. For example, Craven House.

sub_building.description: The first-order entity below a named building or location that represents the sub-premise. Usually a single building within a collection of buildings with a common name. Can be a flat, story, floor, room, or apartment.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.
The shipping details.
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Shipping Details

name.description: The name of the person to whom to ship the items. Supports only the `full_name` property.

options.description: An array of shipping options that the payee or merchant offers to the payer to ship or pick up their items.

items.description: The option that the payee or merchant offers to the payer to ship or pick up their items.

address.description: The address of the person to whom to ship the items. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Shipping Option
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The options that the payee or merchant offers to the payer to ship or pick up their items.

id.description: A unique ID that identifies a payer-selected shipping option.

label.description: A description that the payer sees, which helps them choose an appropriate shipping option. For example, `Free Shipping`, `USPS Priority Shipping`, `Expdition prioritaire USPS`, or `USPS yuxin f hu`. Localize this description to the payer's locale.

type.description: The method by which the payer wants to get their items.

amount.description: The shipping cost for the selected option.

selected.description: If the API request sets `selected = true`, it represents the shipping option that the payee or merchant expects to be pre-selected for the payer when they first view the `shipping.options` in the PayPal Checkout experience. As part of the response if a `shipping.option` contains `selected=true`, it represents the shipping option that the payer selected during the course of checkout with PayPal. Only one `shipping.option` can be set to `selected=true`.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Shipping Type
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The method by which the payer wants to get their items.

x-enum.description: The payer intends to receive the items at a specified address.
The payer intends to pick up the items at a specified address. For example, a store address.

payment_source_response.json.title: Payment Source Response
payment_source_response.json.description: The payment source used to fund the payment.

subscription_billing_info.json.title: Subscription Billing Information
subscription_billing_info.json.description: The billing details for the subscription. If the subscription was or is active, these fields are populated.

outstanding_balance.description: The total pending bill amount, to be paid by the subscriber.

cycle_executions.description: The trial and regular billing executions.

next_billing_time.description: The next date and time for billing this subscription, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

next_payment.description: The next payment amount that the subscriber would be charged.

final_payment_time.description: The date and time when the final billing cycle occurs, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

failed_payments_count.description: The number of consecutive payment failures. Resets to `0` after a successful payment. If this reaches the `payment_failure_threshold` value, the subscription updates to the `SUSPENDED` state.

last_failed_payment.description: The details for the last failed payment of the subscription.

total_paid_amount.description: The amount already paid by the subscriber.

cycle_execution.json.title: Billing Cycle Execution Details
cycle_execution.json.description: The regular and trial execution details for a billing cycle.

tenure_type.description: The type of the billing cycle.

x-enum.description: A regular billing cycle.
A trial billing cycle.

sequence.description: The order in which to run this cycle among other billing cycles.

cycles_completed.description: The number of billing cycles that have completed.

cycles_remaining.description: For a finite billing cycle, cycles_remaining is the number of remaining cycles. For an infinite billing cycle, cycles_remaining is set as 0.

current_pricing_scheme_version.description: The active pricing scheme version for the billing cycle.

amount_payable_per_cycle.description: The amount to be paid per cycle.

total_cycles.description: The number of times this billing cycle gets executed. Trial billing cycles can only be executed a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles). Regular billing cycles can be executed infinite times (value of 0 for total_cycles) or a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles).

last_payment_details.json.title: Last Payment Details
last_payment_details.json.description: The details for the last payment of the subscription.

time.description: The date and time when the last payment was made, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

sender_transaction_id.description: The sender side PayPal-generated transaction ID.

receiver_transaction_id.description: The receiver side PayPal-generated transaction ID.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Capture Status
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The status of a captured payment.

status.description: The status of the captured payment.

x-enum.description: The funds for this captured payment were credited to the payee's PayPal account.
The funds could not be captured.
An amount less than this captured payment's amount was partially refunded to the payer.
The funds for this captured payment was not yet credited to the payee's PayPal account. For more information, see status.details.
An amount greater than or equal to this captured payment's amount was refunded to the payer.
There was an error while capturing payment.

status_details.description: The details of the captured payment status.

merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.title: Capture Status Details
merchant.CommonComponentsSpecification-v.description: The details of the captured payment status.

reason.description: The reason why the captured payment status is `PENDING` or `DENIED`.

x-enum.description: The payer initiated a dispute for this captured payment with PayPal.
The captured funds were reversed in response to the payer disputing this captured payment with the issuer of the financial instrument used to pay for this captured payment.
The payer paid by an eCheck that has not yet cleared.
Visit your online account. In your **Account Overview**, accept and deny this payment.
No additional specific reason can be provided. For more information about this captured payment, visit your account online or contact PayPal.
The captured payment is pending manual review.

The payee has not yet set up appropriate receiving preferences for their account. For more information about how to accept or deny this payment, visit your account online. This reason is typically offered in scenarios such as when the currency of the captured payment is different from the primary holding currency of the payee.
The captured funds were refunded.
The payer must send the funds for this captured payment. This code generally appears for manual EFTs.
The payee does not have a PayPal account.
The payee's PayPal account is not verified.

failed_payment_details.json.title: Failed Payment Details
failed_payment_details.json.description: The details for the failed payment of the subscription.

reason_code.description: The reason code for the payment failure.

x-enum.description: PayPal declined the payment due to one or more customer issues.
An internal server error has occurred.

standard_entry_class_code.description: NACHA (the regulatory body governing the ACH network) requires that API callers (merchants, partners) obtain the consumers explicit authorization before initiating a transaction. To stay compliant, youll need to make sure that you retain a compliant authorization for each transaction that you originate to the ACH Network using this API. ACH transactions are categorized (using SEC codes) by how you capture authorization from the Receiver (the person whose bank account is being debited or credited). PayPal supports the following SEC codes.

x-enum.description: The API caller (merchant/partner) accepts authorization and payment information from a consumer over the telephone.
The API caller (merchant/partner) accepts Debit transactions from a consumer on their website.

Cash concentration and disbursement for corporate debit transaction. Used to disburse or consolidate funds. Entries are usually Optional high-dollar, low-volume, and time-critical. (e.g. intra-company transfers or invoice payments to suppliers).

Prearranged payment and deposit entries. Used for debit payments authorized by a consumer account holder, and usually initiated by a company. These are usually recurring debits (such as insurance premiums).

billing_cycle_override.json.description: The billing cycle details to override at subscription level.

pricing_scheme.description: The active pricing scheme for this billing cycle. A free trial billing cycle does not require a pricing scheme.

tenure_type.description: The tenure type of the billing cycle. In case of a plan having trial cycle, only 2 trial cycles are allowed per plan.

x-enum.description: A regular billing cycle.
A trial billing cycle.

sequence.description: The order in which this cycle is to run among other billing cycles. For example, a trial billing cycle has a `sequence` of `1` while a regular billing cycle has a `sequence` of `2`, so that trial cycle runs before the regular cycle.

total_cycles.description: The number of times this billing cycle gets executed. Trial billing cycles can only be executed a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles). Regular billing cycles can be executed infinite times (value of 0 for total_cycles) or a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles).

taxes.description: The taxation charges for legacy recurring payments.

shipping_amount.description: The shipping charges for legacy recurring payments.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

customized_x_unsupported_7490_merchant.C.title: Capture Status
customized_x_unsupported_7490_merchant.C.description: The status of a captured payment.

status.description: The status of the captured payment.

x-enum.description: The funds for this captured payment were credited to the payee's PayPal account.
The funds could not be captured.
An amount less than this captured payment's amount was partially refunded to the payer.
The funds for this captured payment was not yet credited to the payee's PayPal account. For more information, see status.details.
An amount greater than or equal to this captured payment's amount was refunded to the payer.
There was an error while capturing payment.

customized_x_unsupported_979_merchant.Co.title: Customer
customized_x_unsupported_979_merchant.Co.description: The customer who approves and pays for the order. The customer is also known as the payer.

name.description: The name of the payer. Supports only the `given_name` and `surname` properties.

email_address.description: The email address of the payer.

payer_id.description: The PayPal-assigned ID for the payer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer. Available only when you enable the **Contact Telephone Number** option in the **Profile & Settings** for the merchant's PayPal account. The `phone.phone_number` supports only `national_number`.

customized_x_unsupported_1754_merchant.C.title: Card
customized_x_unsupported_1754_merchant.C.description: The payment card to use to fund a payment. Can be a credit or debit card.

name.description: The card holder's name as it appears on the card.

number.description: The primary account number (PAN) for the payment card.

expiry.description: The card expiration year and month, in [Internet date format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

security_code.description: The three- or four-digit security code of the card. Also known as the CVV, CVC, CVN, CVE, or CID.

billing_address.description: The billing address for this card. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties.

attributes.description: Additional attributes associated with the use of this card.

customized_x_unsupported_159_subscriptio.title: Subscription Modify Plan Request
customized_x_unsupported_159_subscriptio.description: The request to update the quantity of the product or service in a subscription. You can also use this method to switch the plan and update the `shipping_amount` and `shipping_address` values for the subscription. This type of update requires the buyer's consent.

plan_id.description: The unique PayPal-generated ID for the plan.

quantity.description: The quantity of the product or service in the subscription.

effective_time.description: The date and time when this change is effective, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Defaults to the current time.

shipping_address.description: The shipping address of the subscriber.

customized_x_unsupported_9557_applicatio.title: Application Context
customized_x_unsupported_9557_applicatio.description: The application context, which customizes the payer experience during the subscription approval process with PayPal.

brand_name.description: The label that overrides the business name in the PayPal account on the PayPal site.

locale.description: The BCP 47-formatted locale of pages that the PayPal payment experience shows. PayPal supports a five-character code. For example, `da-DK`, `he-IL`, `id-ID`, `ja-JP`, `no-NO`, `pt-BR`, `ru-RU`, `sv-SE`, `th-TH`, `zh-CN`, `zh-HK`, or `zh-TW`.

shipping_preference.description: The location from which the shipping address is derived.

x-enum.description: Get the customer-provided shipping address on the PayPal site.
Redacts the shipping address from the PayPal site. Recommended for digital goods.
Get the merchant-provided address. The customer cannot change this address on the PayPal site. If merchant does not pass an address, customer can choose the address on PayPal pages.

payment_method.description: The customer and merchant payment preferences. Currently only PAYPAL payment method is supported.

return_url.description: The URL where the customer is redirected after the customer approves the payment.

cancel_url.description: The URL where the customer is redirected after the customer cancels the payment.
